programme.title: Open Door
programme.desc: Rudina embarks on a road trip with her pregnant sister Elma back to their Albanian hometown. However, Elma is unmarried, and they need to find someone to play the part of her husband in order not to anger their traditional father.

programme.title: Patchwork Family
programme.desc: Christian is a divorced father who can only see his young daughter Vanessa every other weekend. When he meets the single mother Christine and decides to participate in a summer TV show, his whole life is turned upside down.

programme.title: Catch The Wind
programme.desc: Edith is a middle-aged woman, estranged from her son and now about to lose her job as a textile factory worker. With nothing to hold her to her hometown, she decides to move to Morocco where her factory has relocated instead of facing unemployment.

programme.title: A Son
programme.desc: A family’s holiday in Tunisia ends in disaster, when their 10-year-old son Aziz is shot during a terrorist ambush. At the hospital where Aziz is in desperate need of a transplant, the family discovers a long-buried secret.

programme.title: The Peace And Love Process
programme.desc: Marie and Simon, a couple with two children, are deeply in love despite constant fights in their paired life. To save their marriage, they come up with a chart of Ten Rules to seek love and peace.

programme.title: Not Here To Be Loved
programme.desc: Jean-Claude is a disillusioned middle-age man who has long forgotten to smile. He is divorced, has a strained relationship with his only son and thinks his father never loved him. Then, he steps in to a tango school and meets Francoise and life changes.

programme.title: Oskar & Lilli: Where No One Knows Us
programme.desc: Chechen siblings Oskar and Lilli face deportation from Austria but are separated in foster care after their mother’s suicide attempt. Meeting in secret, the siblings hold onto hope that they will reunite as a family someday.

programme.title: Run Up!
programme.desc: After a life-altering accident shatters her dreams, Elodie, a young hiker turned paraplegic, discovers the power of wheelchair sports. With the help of her trainer Isabelle, she is able to awaken from her lethargy and recognize true victories in life.

programme.title: Murders in B éarn
programme.desc: At the foot of the majestic Béarn mountains, the wife of a notable, dressed as a medieval queen, is discovered drowned under the La Légende bridge in Sauveterre-de-Béarn. The exact spot where, in the 12th century, Queen Sancie was condemned to drowning for infanticide...

programme.title: The Salvation Of The World As We Know It
programme.desc: After a suicide attempt, 17-year-old Paul is sent to a psychiatric centre by his father. There, he encounters other youths with issues just like him, one of whom is Toni.

programme.title: Natatorium
programme.desc: Lilja stays with her estranged grandparents while she auditions for a performance group. When her dad and aunt find out, a sense of panic arises. Dark secrets emerge from the household that threaten to destroy her future career and her life.

programme.title: Helen Dorn: A Little Bit Of Freedom
programme.desc: Haunted by a missing boy's case from 14 years ago, Helen Dorn recently discovers a lead linking to the alleged perpetrator, Ron Faber. Dorn immediately heads for Hamburg when she learns that Faber was apprehended with a deceased Chinese boy in his van.

programme.title: Happier Times, Grump
programme.desc: When Grump's wife dies, he sees no reason to live on. But just as his coffin is finished, Grump gets a new spark and a major secret! His teenage granddaughter is in trouble and needs help and wisdom from her grandfather, and the warmth of his fireplace.

programme.title: Helen Dorn: The Right To Remain Silent
programme.desc: During a hunting trip, Rolf Kanther, director of a military tech manufacturer, is shot right next to his daughter. Inspector Helen Dorn is sent to investigate the suspicious death, and needs to find out if it's an accident or a calculated murder.
